bow: at what age did you stop breastfeeding your child did you ever feel any anxiety over the decision to stop or pressure to keep going stopped at 15 months had originally intended on stopping at year but the breastfeeding guilt kicked in after reading that all european countries believe that years is the minimum screw that by 15 months we were both over it the funny thing was when stopped that when she started sleeping through the night apparently she was waking up to be comforted not because she was hungry once the breastfeeding was off the table she just stopped waking up and asking for it if would have known that would have stopped sooner breastfed my child for one year exactly because that was the personal goal had made fore myself both she and were very ready to be done with it when the time came she weaned easily within week no tears no anxiety she wanted that independence of being able to feed herself loved breastfeeding but the last couple months she became more and more disinterested fidgety and that made it hard to enjoy it as much had no anxiety about stopping for this reason knew she was ready also was looking forward to the freedom of being able to run errands without having to find quiet place to nurse and being able to wear whatever clothing wanted without having to determine if could breastfeed in it do have couple of friends who breastfed their kids past year and did feel perhaps some judgement from them but honestly ignored it you need to listen to your child and your own needs to determine what is best for you breastfeeding is lot of work no exaggeration there it is big commitment especially if you are working or planning on going back to work am stay at home mom also some people have lots of trouble with breastfeeding you need to decide on your own weighing the pros and cons for you and baby then set goal and try to do that hope that helps think we poor moms put too much pressure on ourselves in regards to breastfeeding or formula feeding in the end you have to make the decision that best for you and your family had anxiety the entire time breast fed both of my girls with my first girl the first five months were nightmare of not knowing if she was getting enough to eat because she wanted to nurse all of the times turns out she liked to sip and use me as pacifier when she started sleeping in her own room around months and the nighttime feedings became little less often and suddenly felt like better person we continued until around 13 months because by then she was too busy to nurse and she knew bottles where faster with my second she never seemed to gain weight even though she was much better eater her sister would sip would chug and soon enough she wanted to play with her sister so much that we had to switch to formula around months because she just would sit still and her iron was low hoped she would start to really gain weight on formula but she did and was still in the 10 percentile for quite while but both girls are healthy and active eat variety of fruits and veggies though meat is sometimes hard for them think it texture thing or if it gets too dry when overcooked but **tl dr did feel tons of pressure and anxiety about both wanting to quit bf with my first and wanting to continue bf with my second ** and it was all my own self induced pressure my sweet husband supported me and listened to all my crazy ranting in the end do think it really matters how we feed our babes had terribly low milk supply my baby was gaining it beat me up think overcompensated by nursing being human pacifier with tiny amounts of milk for over years wanted to stop but it seemed so much easier to get her to sleep at night finally quit when my husband promised her would put her to bed it took less than week have nursed her in about 10 months she almost and sometimes she asks if she drank all the milk in there or if there any left if have another child do think nurse that long hated the guilt felt about my low milk supply started finally losing weight when stopped nursing yes it did help me lose just wish did feel so guilty about it for so long felt very much the same way see my post below lot of hardcore bf moms will swear that babies do not wean themselves before year but at 10 months my child would nurse for minutes especially in the evenings and then be done sometimes she would nurse at all my daughter is and we re still nursing do tell many people because do want their opinion on the matter am still nursing my year old and feel very at peace with it for me the hard part was long time ago the first months were nothing but stress anxiety pain confusing etc then we got our shit sorted out around months and nursed happily around 12 month started getting the when will you wean comments mean come on we had finally started to enjoy nursing feel like earned my extra nursing time when there is no pain no anxiety over supply no heath problem nursing is easy now would stop when it finally easy two and half years with my first and then only because my second was due month later he would have loved to keep nursing and had lot of anxiety about stopping it went very well though not sure how long ll continue with my daughter but it will be at least year she much better food eater though so the nursing wont be *quite* as important stopped breastfeeding my son when he was lied to my family and say breastfed until he was 18 months and even then they say went too long was pressured to stop earlier from all of my family and pressured to keep going longer from my so stopped when felt it was time felt very sad when my milk was gone was very excited when got pregnant again am currently breastfeeding my 10 month old and hope to feed her for just as long am anxious about the day have to quit my goal was year my son is now 13 months old and began weaning him few weeks ago we are now down to once day actually love bf and would be ok continuing but still have gotten my period and would like to get pregnant again so figured may need to completely wean first otherwise would probably continue to maybe 18 months my daughter is 16 months still nursing the first in my family to have nursed this long my granny nursed till 12~ months my mum nursed my brother and for amp 10 months aiming for years maybe longer maybe not we ll see when we get there my granny supports my decision though she does still think it little strange do get whole lot of flack except from the occasional family friend and stranger ve been told more times than can count that when they can ask for it is when you should stop but that load of horse shit to me none of my friends were able to breastfeed or wanted to even so another first do really have anyone to encourage or discourage me have happy little girl that smiles all the time is unbelievably smart rarely throws tantrums is hardly grumpy and is teething like champ as long as she happy and healthy doing it for her want to give her her best shot until that begins compromising my own well being or she would choose to wean herself then that exactly what intend to do ve gotten to experience things that no one else know has nursing toddler is awesome she makes faces and breaks for kisses sings blows raspberries it adorable its great time to teach her like facial features hands fingers feet amp toes and belly button her favourite she learned to say please peas when she wants to nurse rarely bothered by her wanting to nurse unless we re sick and she wants to nurse constantly its no inconvenience to me so why not sorry got distracted stopped little over months had been pumping enough and with feeding him food was starting to dry up little also we were going to be moving and were going to have the time to stop and lazily feel him every couple of ours feel little guilty but then remember my husband and my sister in law were breastfed and they turned are some of the smartest and healthiest people know me and my brother were for two years and we both get sick all the time we only made it to months had to switch to exclusive pumping sometime around weeks old because she was getting enough milk and found out why just was making enough have pcos and it fucks with milk production but tried goddamnit was hooked to that pump every hours and never slept more than because was afraid of ruining what little supply had left was an emotional wreck over it as watched my milk supply drop the closer got to the month mark but kept going and kept fighting to make sure she got what she needed let go at months and stopped pumping had to because it was the most stressful thing in my life at that time and was getting to enjoy being parent at all feel like the first months of my kid life spent sitting in chair hooked up to pump even with all of what went through to get her breastmilk still catch shit from people like my uncle wife nurse who believes that the body will make what the baby needs no matter what and women who do produce enough are just lazy and were feeding the baby enough and on schedule you know because bodies never do anything they re not supposed to do or stop working due to medical conditions ugh sorry got ranty so yeah there was lot of anxiety and pressure to keep going but think if had kept it up much longer have ended up needing therapy just hit the 17 month mark today am aiming for years before consider weaning her if she decides to wean herself before then okay with that too it comfort thing she known from day it gives us solid one on one time and it guaranteed to calm her down on those really crazy days do want to be the one to stop it and take it from her until she can understand why we re no longer breastfeeding it also helps to know that my body will continue to help her when she becomes ill and she filling in the gaps she may still have in her diet otherwise had my daughter months early so had to pump exclusively every hours for months until she came home then when she came home could take care of her pump sterilize feed her with bottle sterilize and everything else it was too much and she has always been very high maintenance just like the nurses told me she would be lol apparently lots of preemies are so altogether bf for months and wish could have for longer but did my best and with all the stress of her being in the hospital and almost passing away think did very well was only 19 at the time as well that matured me quickly believe me stopped breastfeeding my first at 10 months my goal was months and anything past that was bonus to me it was pretty much mutual decision to stop because my body was slowing down production and she was much too active and distractible to stay at the breast for any period of time did feel any anxiety because it felt like the right time to stop and honestly did have anyone to pressure me into continuing my new daughter is only months old and my goal is the same with her at least months and then any time past that is bonus if we make it to year that be when plan to stop nursed until 21 22 months not exactly sure when but know before his second birthday he just lost interest one day and that was fine by me miss the snuggles though little after two years the last six months or so it was an issue many people even brought up probably because we were down to only nap and bedtime nursing no anxiety or pressure to stop or keep going hope nursing goes the same way my first completely stopped at months had production issues and was constantly feeding pumping also had to go back to work after weeks she was week late and had section so was attempting to feed before left work pumping at least times at work then coming home and bf her then do combo of bf and pumping through the night she would be on one side and would be pumping on the other by the time months rolled around was getting at most oz day from pumping and my daughter frustration at not getting anything was quite audible so cried because felt was failure bad pregnancy bad labor amp delivery bad healing postpartum then could feed my kid it was good feeling overall then fed her formula until she was 1ish she had already started on some solids though so that helped now am almost month into lo and the experience could be more different she was born at 38w 5d so she was much smaller than her sister still good eater but we have had latching issues that made it really hard so back to mostly pumping while we work on the latching fortunately it seems that my supply is not problem right now have even had enough to freeze little extra each day will be taking 12 weeks off for this one so will be pumping again when go back to work would optimally like to be able to keep her on breast milk until at least year then we can switch her over but if ca then at least this time do feel like have completely failed and know that formula is viable alternative and am just glad we live in day and age where these things are available lord knows would have been able to afford wet nurse back in the day found it incredibly hard to stop breastfeeding did stop until my son was around always felt that there would be natural point where he would need it anymore breastfed my son for 17 months was so ready to be done and he weaned easily did it because wanted to no one was pressuring me to stop also did feel guilty stopping because my original goal was year and was happy made it at least that far none of my friends who nursed longer tried to make me feel bad they were supportive of me and was supportive of them continuing to nurse stopped at just over two and was getting pressured to stop but wanted to keep going it was all academic in the end because had to start medication that made breastfeeding inadvisable so had to wean but made my doctor wait almost month so could do it slow felt tons of anxiety about stopping because did feel we were ready felt huge pressure to keep going but wanted to go back to work it took me about hours per day to pump or breastfeed and just could do it anymore 12 months felt bad but was pg again and it hurt terribly 24 months pg again felt fine about it 18 months not pg but she was very obnoxious nurser and was just done felt bad for short time 27 months not pg but was done did feel bad my daughter is 19 months and tell people plan on going to if she wants and stare at them and dare them to say anything act like it normal and they usually keep their mouth shut years oh man going on 15 months and am planning to let my daughter self wean she eats variety of different foods now but shows no less interest in nursing as of yet hoping to stop around age and guess assumed she self wean around that point now bit worried about that plan my son went until 14 months would have loved to continue longer but nothing would break his frequent night nursing habit and waking times night then going to work was getting too difficult we had rough couple weeks when cut him off but we managed to make it looking forward to nursing with my second this summer but wonder if she ll be like her brother my first stopped nursing when she was about but did consider herself weaned until her 5th birthday my second just turned and may or may not be weaned she nurses so sporadically nowadays that it hard to say for sure until it been pretty long time feel pretty committed to child led weaning but have felt some pressure to stop my mom thinks it ridiculous and probably harmful but do really talk about it with her or with my in laws think that they just assume that she weaned by now you re awesome wanted to make it to year stopped at 11 months week because my md prescribed celexa for depression and did want it to affect my baby it honestly went great he is big baby and has been wanting to feed himself for awhile he quickly stopped using pacifier and is all about being big boy now felt little guilty but needed my medicine and was only weeks shy of my goal miss breastfeeding because it was such wonderful quality time with my baby only lasted week with my first so really did want to give up too soon with my second at peace about it stopped at 15 months wanted to continue we were both happy with the bf relationship but with his food allergies and mine just could seem to keep it all under control still wish bf longer but it was so amazing the improvement in his health when could restrict his diet and not have to worry so much about mine and his read that the second baby usually has less allergies due to your body knowing better how to help in utero or something so hopeful number will be good breast feeder and we can make it longer mine just turned months old today and kept saying ll quit when he months old but here am and now say ll wean him when he year old but honestly do want to stop just like everyone else it now getting fun even tho it hurts like hell when he gets his two shark teeth in my nipple people have looked at me like was different because was breastfeeding and it was weird but do care it something special share with my son stopped breastfeeding my oldest child at weeks he was cluster feeding and did know what was normal or not all my family formula fed so they kept assuring me that it was not normal and that he should be going longer between feedings they convinced me that must not be producing enough milk and that he was hungry so switched him to formula almost immediately regretted it and felt so disappointed in myself for giving in to that pressure when really wanted to continue breastfeeding my second child is months old and we are still breastfeeding plan to make it to at least year but we are already getting the how much longer remarks it hard because you try to do what you feel is best but no matter what that may be you seem to get told how wrong you are having issues currently with my month old being extraordinarily clingy and needy pretty sure it just her temperment and she just velcro baby but nope according to the peanut gallery it obviously because we re still breastfeeding and co sleeping and we really need to switch to formula and just let her cry it out sigh know had so many weird looks after she could walk felt massive pressure to breastfeed from the start both times quit breastfeeding baby after month and baby after two weeks felt immense guilt over quitting the first time the second time not as much the constant shaming for formula feeding from family and medical professionals did help my daughter is and we ll continue to nurse as long as she wants get lot of looks and questions about when are we going to stop just sarcastically answer well figured follow her to college so she could nurse between classes she my last baby ll never nurse again once she stops therefore in no rush to end it my oldest self weaned at 15 months would have gone longer with her had she been interested 15 months stopped nursing because wanted to get pregnant again and breastfeeding was preventing that from happening no outside pressure to stop or to continue either way but did get asked about weaning plans more often once lo turned stopped with my son at 20 months only because got pregnant and my body could handle feeding two kids plus myself the kiddo have now just turned one year on sunday and we are still going strong and not even thinking of weaning we stopped at 14 months my little one was just not as interested nursing was more of chore think her and were both just done we started giving her milk and then every now and then would nurse her the swelling when stopped was extremely uncomfortable also pregnant with our 2nd that may of caused me discomfort when nursing think you should just see what works best for you and your munchkin have friends who only made it months and some that are going strong at age stopped breastfeeding my daughter when she was year did feel some pressure to stop and was afraid would feel very sad when did but felt just fine and the little one carried on like nothing had even changed my daughter is two and quarter and still nursing like it her business before had kids thought over year was little strange planned on nursing months and would see how felt from there it turns out that really like nursing sure there are times when it drives me little crazy and quite often like the option to drink whole bottle of wine but the benefits of not nursing still do outweigh the benefits of continuing so here we are imagine we will continue until she ready to give it up on her own deleted stopped at months had to deal with lots of shaming over it glad that over my daughter was 17 months and then got pregnant immediately but we were trying my son made it to only six months just was feeling it the second time and that okay felt only little bad about stopping but really wanted my body back to myself deleted stopped breastfeeding at years old after it was only at naps amp bedtime my family thought it was weird and gross that was still breastfeeding after after age got lot of disapproving stares and gasps when fed him in public and felt little anxiety to stop then but shortly after it was just in our home deleted deleted that was my goal and totally felt the same way about nursing past one now my daughter is almost and still nursing not at all what would have planned but it the way things have worked out also nursing my 18 month old son wow way to go mama did he self wean my oldest quit when he was 11 months weaned my middle child at year not sure what plan for little probably year was stressed about it from what ve read the first year is recommended and since both of my older kids were good eaters did see an issue did notice any pressure but do really associate with many other moms hated breastfeeding from start to finish however my son was premie and absolutely needed the extra help breast milk gives so breast fed for six months because that was as long as could stand never took anyone else opinion because theirs did matter my husband supported me no matter what chose stopped when he was about months partly because he was interested partly because my supply had severely dropped probably because was about months pregnant at that point probably also reason he was into it anymore felt bad for long time he almost 14 months now and he doing great and think he really likes the independence of holding his own bottle so trying to get over it aiming for year again with baby but not going to beat myself up this time if it not meant to be stopped at months for my first because she was had teeth and would stop gnawing and had problems with milk supply it did help that she was lactose intolerant and had hard time cutting cheese out of my diet my newest one is months and trying to make it to or months before we wean my supply is lot better so she gaining weight better she will nurse and still eat whole jar of baby food so guess how long nurse depends on how big her appetite gets ll still supplement with nursing but she really just enjoys eating from spoon my job has been horrible about my breastfeeding and work in hospital went back to work at months pp day have been harassed every shift about pumping around six months started getting the omigod you need to wean him before he becomes mama jboy and he only needs your milk the first six months why are you torturing yourself comments it ridiculous my goal is one year but if he goes past that we ll slowly start to wean but not going to suddenly just refuse him thanks but really just do give what people think about my parenting choices my son self weaned day nursing probably around 14 months or so but night nursed up until recently self weaned between 21 and 22 months he just turned 22 months let him take the lead on when he wanted to stop nursing and put no pressure on him either way when people would ask how long planned to nurse till would tell them whenever it feels right to us because did have an answer did have an age in mind where thought that would be it for us basically was going with the flow and doing whatever felt right for our situation find that answering that way would usually shut people up fortunately have had to deal with this much my goal was to make it to months and or first teeth she just turned months and is teething but still no teeth for my own personal health reasons would really like to stop however she still very attached to it as comfort getting her to take bottle is an uphill battle so we re at stand still for now will quit as soon as can we ll have to see how food goes definitely feel push back on this desire it seems like people really push the year thing ve found if express desire to quit it dismissed oh year is so much better you ll be so used to it by months you wo want to quit yada this is really encouraging to me my baby is almost months and we are still struggling in many ways the idea that we might still sort it out and enjoy long nursing relationship is awesome everyone told me it would get better at weeks then then 12 then four months sometimes one problem is solved and then another pops up what really needed to hear what that no matter what it would be forever either because problems resolved or he grew up or weaned or we moved to formula whichever in the end the result is the same it would last forever so it wo last forever no matter what you decide whatever is right for you and your baby it wo last forever is there anything we might be able to help you with my son turned week ago and we are still nursing ve been getting lot of comments about stopping weaning advice etc he is very attached to the breast and think it helpful to have the breast feeding bond while he in his tough toddler years would have loved to breastfeed my baby for longer time sadly he never was able to latch we tried everything only breastfed him up until months old after that started pumping the milk my milk supply stopped when my baby was months it was bit sad experience but he healthy beautiful almost year old now my son is 20 months and tell people that hope he weans himself before he 12 still nursing my 32 month old but am considering weaning because am 24 weeks pregnant and feeling strong nursing aversion the last two days the sensation of her nursing has just made my skin crawl but she just nursed bit and felt fine have anxiety over stopping or when to stop because loved nursing her but there are so many pros and cons to tandem nursing for me just wish knew what was best nursed my older child until she was 22 months we cut back to nap and bedtime with the occasional nursing inbetween until got pregnant and my supply was mostly dried up and my nipples were very tender heard the are you still nursing question very often in condescending voice and always replied with frank yes have week old daughter and breastfeeding has been struggle had to have an emergency section and my milk did come in until she was days old we had to start her on formula because refused to have hungry baby ended up with an infection in my incision and had to take high dose of antibiotics which depleted my supply even more my milk has never fully come in can maybe get about ounces day when pump feel like my body has put more energy into trying to heal from the infection than trying to produce milk on top of it my daughter is slightly tongue tied so worry that when she does nurse it difficult for her to get anything and feel like she gets frustrated ve felt extremely guilty about not being able to exclusively breastfeed so keep trying and at least she gets oz of breast milk every couple of days it very frustrating
